item.description:
We have a special speaker this month!

Chris Willenborg, Mass DOT, Administrator Aeronautics Division.

 

MAC is a state transportation agency under the jurisdiction of the Executive Office of Transportation.

In addition to his eight years leading the Westfield-Barnes Airport, Willenborg also served for three years as President of the Massachusetts Airport Management Association. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Aviation Business Administration from Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University in Florida.

MAC has jurisdiction over the Commonwealth's 37 public use airports of which 24 are publicly owned and 13 privately owned, 2 seaplane bases, and 184 private use landing areas. It is responsible for airport development and improvements, aviation safety, aircraft accident investigation, navigational aids, and statewide aviation planning. MAC certifies airports and heliports, licenses airport managers, conducts annual airport inspections, and enforces safety and security regulations.

Don't miss this opportunity to discuss our future with one of the states top decision makers. More details will follow.

Charley

--------------------------------------------------------------------

As always, food at 6:00 and meeting at 7:00.

 

Fly Often and Fly Safe,
Charley
